definition: the straw that broke the camel’s back (idiom)/the final straw
pinyin: ya1 si3 luo4 tuo5 de5 zui4 hou4 yi1 gen1 dao4 cao3
traditional: 壓死駱駝的最後一根稻草
word: 压死骆驼的最后一根稻草

definition: see 壓根兒|压根儿[ya4 gen1 r5]
to press/to push down/to keep under (control)/pressure
camel/white horse with a black mane (archaic)
of/~'s (possessive particle)/(used after an attribute)/(used to form a nominal expression)/(used at the end of a declarative sentence for emphasis)
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
root/basis/classifier for long slender objects, e.g. cigarettes, guitar strings/CL:條|条[tiao2]/radical (chemistry)
to cause sth to collapse under the weight/(fig.) to overwhelm
fuse (for explosives)/(fig.) proximate cause/the last straw
sacrificial victim/sb who is expendable/item sold at a loss
lit. target of a multitude of arrows (idiom); the butt of public criticism/attacked on all sides
(idiom) to have one's words turn out to be (tragically) prophetic
variant of 幫凶|帮凶[bang1 xiong1]
one stumble, unable to rise (idiom); a setback leading to total collapse/ruined at a stroke/unable to recover after a minor hitch
not to affect sb/irrelevant/of no importance/insignificant
to settle a matter by leaving it unsettled/to end up with nothing definite
